channel.title: [PHP] Example Use of Classes
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I've been working with PHP for a while now and I was just wondering if anyone can show/tell me an example of when you would use classes in PHP. When I'm working with PHP, I NEVER use them, simply because I've never needed to. What uses do they have?
Sam.

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Syrillia:

I understand that it will make it slow when the number of files builds up, but I couldn’t work out how to include a file only when a function of the same name is called. Should I use custom error handling to include them when the undefined error occurs?

It’s not just bad because it’s slow, it’s bad because it is a huge security risk. You should group similar functions into one file, and when you need to call those functions, include that one file.

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Syrillia, post:11, topic:351631”]I’m using this:

	$dir = new RecursiveDirectoryIterator("./files/");

	foreach (new RecursiveIteratorIterator($dir) as $filename => $file) {
		require($filename);
	}

To loop through several folders and include every file in them. I figured it saved from having to bung them all in one file and make it hard to find functions.[/quote]

That is a horrible way to do it, for many, many reasons. If you want me to list them out I guess I can, but I really shouldn’t need to. Only include the php files that you NEED.

Read full topic
